DataSource.Name: Default
DataSource.SQL: select §§n Convert(varchar, T.TransactionFiscalDate, 103) as [Date],§§n LOC.DisplayName as [Location],§§n OPA.DisplayName as [OpArea],§§n Cast(W.StationSerial as varchar(max)) + ' (' + W.WorkstationName + ')' as [Workstation],§§n UsrLogin.UserName,§§n UsrEmail.UserName as [LoginEmail],§§n USR.DisplayName as [User],§§n S.SaleCode as [PNR],§§n A.DisplayName as [Account],§§n P.PaymentAmount as [Amount]§§nfrom§§n tbTransaction T inner join§§n tbSale S on S.SaleId=T.SaleId inner join§§n tbWorkstation W on W.WorkstationId=T.WorkstationId inner join§§n tbAccount OPA on OPA.AccountId=T.OpAreaId inner join§§n tbAccount LOC on LOC.AccountId=OPA.ParentAccountId inner join§§n tbAccount USR on USR.AccountId=T.UserAccountId inner join§§n tbPayment P on P.TransactionId=T.TransactionId inner join§§n tbPaymentCredit PC on PC.PaymentId=P.PaymentId left outer join§§n tbAccount A on A.AccountId=PC.AccountId left join§§n tbLoginAlias UsrLogin on UsrLogin.AccountId=Usr.AccountId and UsrLogin.LoginAliasType=0 left join§§n tbLoginAlias UsrEmail on UsrEmail.AccountId=Usr.AccountId and UsrEmail.LoginAliasType=1§§nwhere§§n T.TransactionFiscalDate >= :@DateFrom and§§n DateAdd(day, -1, T.TransactionFiscalDate) < :@DateTo and§§n (:@OpAreaId is null or OPA.AccountId=:@OpAreaId) and§§n (:@LocationId is null or LOC.AccountId=:@LocationId) §§norder by §§n T.TransactionDateTime§§n §§n
